Comments_List: I learned about a few different matrix theories and their applications.

The course is a seminar-style introduction to random matrix theory. The methods illustrated are measure concentration, moment method, Stieltjes transform and free probability. The course also brings us to see how theory is applied in various interesting aspects, including graph analysis, PCA etc.
An introduction to random matrix theory
I learnt a lot about random matrices
The material is well organized. The delivery is engaging. The teacher is fabulous.
I think a 2.5 hour intense lecture is very tiring, and I could hardly concentrate at the end. Maybe divided into two 1.25 hour lectures is better.

I would definitely recommend this course. A little bit intellectual challenging though, you will get to know a lot of techniques that commonly arise in your research. The organization of the material is great!
Yes. Random matrix theory is a very beautiful and useful subject.
